stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream building and debugging the interior "power-plant" section of the oil level for Return to Yoshi’s Island.  Work centers on new moving platforms, hiding a Yoshi-coin puzzle, testing performance, and brainstorming two new enemies (a psychedelic “oil fuzzy” and redesigned electric Amps).  He also demonstrates matrix and FOV warping for a trippy visual effect and discusses memory / FPS optimisations.

development_findings.summary: Elevator/treadmill object added; overlapping duplicate models caused Mario to ignore displacement until removed and collision defined.
development_findings.quote: What if there were two of the exact same platform in the exact same spot overlapping each other … that’s why it didn’t work.

development_findings.summary: Performance rose from 43-45 FPS to ~49 FPS after inlining and culling tweaks, though one change dropped it back to 47; 60 FPS remains the target.
development_findings.quote: We went from 43 to 45 FPS to the range of 45 to 49 FPS and then I fixed some culling thing and now the FPS are down to 47 again, but still.

development_findings.summary: Mario’s squash-and-stretch code was recently rewritten; scaling now responds more strongly to velocity.
development_findings.quote: I actually did rework this recently and I think it looks a lot better now.

development_findings.summary: Hidden Yoshi-coin puzzle planned: coin floats high in first room; player must ground-pound a hanging platform to lower it, landing on added pipes/generator scenery.
development_findings.quote: Imagine a Yoshi coin somewhere up here … the only way to get it would be to pull this platform down and then hit it.

development_findings.summary: Oil Fuzzy enemy concept: contact triggers psychedelic viewport wobble, rainbow lighting on oil, larger squash-stretch, slippery movement, audio pitch-bend; no direct damage.
development_findings.quote: The water is gonna be super rainbow … Mario’s gonna slide all over the place; it’s gonna feel uncontrollable.

development_findings.summary: Amp enemies will be fully rebuilt (Odyssey-style glow, move along wires/ground) to reinforce the electrical theme inside the plant.
development_findings.quote: We’re gonna make completely new amps anyway … make them look kind of like Mario Odyssey.

development_findings.summary: Considered replacing four transition textures with SVG-generated polygons to save ~1.5 KB ROM space; benefit deemed marginal.
development_findings.quote: You save nine kilobytes of room space … it’s very close to nothing.

development_findings.summary: Additional small optimisations found (function inlining, fast inverse square root tweaks); Kaze feels only minor gains remain.
development_findings.quote: We’re slowly getting to a point where I no longer know any more optimisations which is crazy.

development_findings.summary: Plan to release one or two smaller, click-friendly hacks before RTYI to fine-tune camera and physics and ensure financial viability.
development_findings.quote: Before RTYI’s release I do want to release one or two more demos where people can just play-test the physics and stuff.

context_findings.summary: Kaze recently moved; workstation is now in a basement, Zeina works upstairs.
context_findings.quote: Zeina is finally out of my hair – she is upstairs now and I'm downstairs.

context_findings.summary: He is frustrated by constant questions about release dates.
context_findings.quote: I hope we can go a whole stream without people asking me for release dates every 15 minutes.

context_findings.summary: Audience has shifted toward programmers after the source-code decompilation, influencing content choices.
context_findings.quote: I feel like a lot of programmers watch my channel now and not so much the casual audience ever since the source code revert.

context_findings.summary: Kaze will not tackle a full Ocarina of Time remaster without substantial financial incentive.
context_findings.quote: I would like to do OOT next but I need financial incentive – it would be irresponsible honestly.

context_findings.summary: He is under NDA at Gears for Breakfast and cannot reveal his current commercial project.
context_findings.quote: I am NOT allowed to tell what I am working on. I'm still actively working there.

biobak.summary: Level will remain visually rough until Biobak re-textures it; Kaze defers aesthetic changes to him.
biobak.quote: I guess this whole area is gonna be ugly until Biobak gets to it.

biobak.summary: Suggested replacing texture-based transitions with polygonal/vertex-alpha cut-outs; Kaze analysed memory savings.

zeina.summary: No development activity mentioned; only note is new upstairs workspace, playful banter with Kaze.

key_stories.title: Debugging the Invisible Elevator
key_stories.summary: A new elevator platform failed to move Mario.  After testing, Kaze discovered two identical overlapping objects with missing collision data.
key_stories.challenge: Platform displacement did not affect Mario, implying a systemic bug.
key_stories.process: Confirmed other platforms still worked, searched for causes, realised duplicate objects existed and collision flag was unset.
key_stories.outcome: Removed duplicate, added collision, elevator now functions; serves as treadmill set-piece for the room.
key_stories.key_quote: What if there were two of the exact same platform in the exact same spot overlapping each other – that's why it didn't work.

key_stories.title: Inventing the Oil Fuzzy Psychedelic Mechanic
key_stories.summary: Kaze prototypes an "oil fuzzy" enemy that induces trippy visuals, rainbow lighting, and slippery controls when touched, aligning with Yoshi’s Island lore.
key_stories.challenge: Need a distinctive enemy for the power-plant that also references Yoshi’s Island fuzzies.
key_stories.process: Live-coded matrix and FOV warping, experimented with hue rotation and audio slowdown, brainstormed added effects (sliding physics, exaggerated squash-stretch).
key_stories.outcome: Settled on full feature list; implementation scheduled for next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: The water is gonna be super rainbow; the whole viewport is gonna go – it’s gonna feel uncontrollable.

open_questions.topic: Final behaviour and visuals of Oil Fuzzy
open_questions.context: Concept defined but details such as exact duration, recovery method, and whether it damages Mario remain undecided.
questions: How long will the psychedelic state last and how does the player end it?
Will the Oil Fuzzy appear outside the plant level as well?
Does it inflict HP damage or only environmental danger?

open_questions.context: Kaze wants Odyssey-style glowing Amps that travel along wires and across the ground but concrete design and asset work not started.
questions: What movement patterns will the new Amps have?
Who will model and animate them?
Will they interact with the dynamic lighting system Kaze mentioned?

open_questions.context: Memory-saving ideas (SVG transitions) and FPS targets (60) were discussed but the project’s hard limits weren’t clarified.
questions: What is the current ROM and RAM headroom for RTYI?
Are there other planned memory cuts besides transitions?
Is 60 FPS a firm ship target for every level?

open_questions.context: Kaze intends to launch small demos before RTYI to test physics and camera while generating revenue.

open_questions.context: Stream shows ad-hoc chat suggestions; formal pipeline between Kaze, Biobak, Badub, and Zeina is unclear.
